news.title: Serious pollution incidents by water companies up 60% last year
news.summary: Last year saw record levels of pollution incidents in England, such as the release of untreated sewage, the Environment Agency says.

news.title: Germany's Merz tells BBC Europe was free-riding on US
news.summary: Merz was visiting the UK to boost defence ties with Germany, as part of a historic friendship treaty.

news.title: Trusting The Salt Path author was our biggest mistake, family says
news.summary: A family who claim The Salt Path author stole thousands from their business say trusting her was a big mistake.

news.title: Unique 1.5m year-old ice to be melted to unlock mystery
news.summary: BBC News went inside -23C freezers to see the ice that could "revolutionise" our knowledge of climate change.

news.title: Kill Russian soldiers, win points: Is Ukraine's new drone scheme gamifying war?
news.summary: The scheme allows Ukrainian troops to trade videos of confirmed kills on the battlefield for prizes.

news.title: Amber weather warning issued as thunderstorms and flooding to cause significant disruption
news.summary: The Met Office has issued an amber warning for thunderstorms and flooding for Saturday morning with disruption expected.

news.title: Doctor and husband jailed for selling stolen PPE on eBay
news.summary: Dr Attiya Sheikh, 45, and 48-year-old Omer Sheikh made almost Â£8,000 during the Covid pandemic in 2020.

news.title: Klarna among those to introduce stricter credit checks on customers
news.summary: Long-promised regulation of the sector will come into force next July, but lenders will have some flexibility.

news.title: Relentless immigration raids are changing California's way of life
news.summary: A month since Donald Trump called in the National Guard, raids continue to spark violent protests - and fear.

news.title: Minister denies Labour wants Abbott out of party
news.summary: Diane Abbott is suspended as a Labour MP after she said she did not regret "at all" a previous suspension.
